discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges web application (Flask/Werkzeug 1.0.1 Python 2.7.18) - Port 5001
localhost:5001/ - Main homepage endpoint (200 OK, static HTML with one challenge link)
localhost:5001/static/css/xss/index.css - XSS challenge CSS (200 OK, 1000 bytes)

targets.objective: Test for XSS, injection vulnerabilities, and parameter pollution on homepage; verify HTTP method restrictions are properly enforced; test for path traversal in relative link handling
targets.rationale: Main application endpoint serving HTML with linked challenge. Link references xss25 which returns 404 - potential for injection or malformed URL handling vulnerabilities

targets.objective: Test for path traversal vulnerabilities in static file serving; attempt to access parent directories (../) and sensitive files; verify directory listing is properly disabled
targets.rationale: Static file serving is a common attack vector. Directory listing disabled is good, but path traversal could allow access to sensitive application files or configuration

targets.objective: Verify HTTP method restrictions; test for Method Override vulnerabilities (X-HTTP-Method-Override header); verify TRACE/CONNECT are disabled; test for HTTP Response Splitting
targets.rationale: Application properly returns 405 for unsupported methods, but should verify no bypasses exist through headers or method overrides

targets.objective: Evaluate absence of Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, HSTS, X-Content-Type-Options, and other security headers; assess impact on XSS and clickjacking vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Application lacks security headers which increase exposure to XSS, clickjacking, and other client-side attacks

targets.objective: Scan for known CVEs in Werkzeug 1.0.1, Python 2.7.18, and Flask; assess impact of using end-of-life Python version; check for information disclosure through error pages
targets.rationale: Python 2.7 is end-of-life with no security updates. Werkzeug 1.0.1 is outdated. Application reveals version information in Server header (information disclosure)

keyFindings: [MEDIUM] End-of-Life Software Stack: Application uses Python 2.7.18 (EOL since 2020) and Werkzeug 1.0.1 (outdated). No security patches available for vulnerabilities.
[MEDIUM] Information Disclosure via Server Header: Application reveals Server header 'Werkzeug/1.0.1 Python/2.7.18' - enables version-specific attack targeting
[MEDIUM] Incomplete Application: Homepage references 'xss25' challenge endpoint which returns 404 - indicates incomplete implementation or broken functionality
[LOW] Missing Security Headers: No Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, HSTS, X-Content-Type-Options detected - increases XSS/clickjacking attack surface
[LOW] No POST Method Support: Application blocks POST requests (405) on root endpoint - limits potential attack vectors but verify enforcement is consistent
[LOW] Static Assets Accessible: Static files are properly served and accessible (CSS, images, favicon) - no directory listing enabled (good security practice)
